reasoning: Cone-rod dystrophies (CRD) are rare inherited retinal disorders with estimated prevalence of 1 in 40,000-1 in 100,000 globally. CRD3 (GUCA1A mutation) is one of several subtypes. Prevalence metric used for this lifelong genetic condition. Low confidence due to limited epidemiological data and reliance on case series.
source: Michaelides M et al. (2006). Cone-rod dystrophies: genetics, phenotypes and mechanisms. Prog Retin Eye Res. 25(2):171-197
